amendment.description: Amendment increases funding for special education by $25 million.
amendment.purpose: An amendment, printed as amendment No. 17 in the Congressional Record of July 29, 1997, to increase the appropriation for special education by $155.5 million. The offsets would occur in reductions of $133.6 million for education research, statistics and improvement and $35 million for education reform and $6.9 million for highter education.

vote.text: On agreeing to the Goodling amendment (A002) Agreed to by voice vote.
